event.title: grew from what had been a small, little-known fishing village in 1457

data.event: Edo grew from what had been a small, little-known fishing village in 1457 into the largest metropolis in the world with an estimated population of 1,000,000 by 1721.

event.title: fires, with the Great Fire of Meireki in 1657

data.event: Edo was repeatedly devastated by fires, with the Great Fire of Meireki in 1657 being the most disastrous.
Between 1600 and 1945, Edo/Tokyo was leveled every 25–50 years or so by fire, earthquakes, or war.
